フシギダネ: 不思議 (fushigi, mysterious/strange) + 種 (tane, seed). Pun on 'fushigi da ne?' ('Isn't it strange?').
フシギソウ: 不思議 (fushigi, mysterious/strange) + 草 (sō, grass/plant). Evolves from Bulbasaur, plant motif continues.
フシギバナ: 不思議 (fushigi, mysterious/strange) + 花 (bana, flower). Final form, flower motif.
ヒトカゲ: 火 (hi, fire) + 蜥蜴 (tokage, lizard). Simple, direct description.
ゼニガメ: 銭 (zeni, coin) + 亀 (kame, turtle). Refers to pond turtles that resemble coins.
カメール: カメ (kame, turtle) + possible wordplay on 'tail' or 'mail.'
カメックス: カメ (kame, turtle) + 強い (tsuyoi, strong) or 'max' sound. Suggests maximum power.
ポッポ: Onomatopoeia for a bird's coo. Common wild bird.
コラッタ: 子 (ko, child) + ratta (rat). Small rat Pokémon.
オニスズメ: 鬼 (oni, demon) + 雀 (suzume, sparrow). Aggressive sparrow.
オニドリル: 鬼 (oni, demon) + ドリル (doriru, drill). Refers to its long beak.
ピカチュウ: ピカピカ (pika, sparkle/flash) + チュウ (chū, mouse squeak). Iconic electric mouse.
ライチュウ: 雷 (rai, thunder) + チュウ (chū, squeak). Pikachu's evolved form.
サンドパン: サンド (sand) + パンゴリン (pangolin). Spiny anteater.
ニドラン♀: 'Nido' from 'needle.' 'Ran' is a name suffix. Female form.
ニドラン♂: 'Nido' from 'needle.' 'Ran' is a name suffix. Male form.
ロコン: 六 (roku, six) + コン (kon, fox yelp). Fox with six tails.
キュウコン: 九 (kyū, nine) + コン (kon, fox yelp). Based on kitsune myth.
ズバット: ズバッ (zuba, slicing sound) + bat. Swooping bat.
コンパン: 粉 (kon, powder) + パン (pan, ball). Fuzzy bug.
ニョロモ: ニョロニョロ (nyoronyoro, wriggle) + モ (mo, child).
ニョロゾ: ニョロニョロ (nyoro, wriggle) + ゾウ (zō, suffix).
ニョロボン: ニョロニョロ (nyoro, wriggle) + ボン (bon, big).
マダツボミ: まだ (mada, not yet) + 蕾 (tsubomi, bud).
ウツドン: ウツボカズラ (utsubokazura, pitcher plant) + -don.
ウツボット: ウツボカズラ (utsubokazura, pitcher plant) + 'bot.'
メノクラゲ: 目 (me, eye) + クラゲ (kurage, jellyfish).
ドククラゲ: 毒 (doku, poison) + クラゲ (kurage, jellyfish).
イシツブテ: 石 (ishi, stone) + つぶて (tsubute, throwing stone).
カモネギ: 鴨 (kamo, duck) + 葱 (negi, leek). 'Kamo-negi' is a proverb about unexpected luck.
ビリリダマ: ビリビリ (biribiri, electric shock) + 玉 (dama, ball).
マルマイン: 丸 (maru, round) + マイン (mine, as in landmine).
ベロリンガ: ベロ (bero, tongue) + リンガ (linga, linger).
トサキント: トサカ (tosaka, crest) + 金魚 (kingyo, goldfish).
エレブー: エレキ (ereki, electric) + ブー (boo, sound).
ラプラス: From mathematician Pierre-Simon Laplace. Sea transport motif.
カビゴン: カビ (kabi, mold) + ゴン (gon, big). Sleepy, large Pokémon.
チコリータ: From the herb chicory (チコリー *chikorī*) + Spanish diminutive “-ita,” meaning “little.”
ベイリーフ: Katakana rendering of “bay leaf,” the aromatic herb. Reflects the leaf around its neck.
メガニウム: Blends “mega” (large) with “geranium,” indicating a large flowering herb.
ヒノアラシ: 火の嵐 (*hi no arashi*), literally “storm of fire,” referencing the flames on its back.
マグマラシ: マグマ (magma) + 嵐 (storm), continuing Cyndaquil’s naming motif with intensified heat.
バクフーン: 爆風 (*bakufū*, blast of wind) + 台風 (*taifū*, typhoon). Conveys explosive, gale-like flames.
ワニノコ: ワニ (wani, crocodile) + の子 (no ko, “child of”). A baby crocodilian.
アリゲイツ: From “alligator” (*arigētā*) with a clipped/childlike form. Suggests a young gator.
オーダイル: 王 (*ō*, king) + 「ダイル」 (from *crocodile*). Implies a regal/ultimate crocodile.
オタチ: 尾 (*o*, tail) + 立つ (*tatsu*, to stand) + イタチ (*itachi*, weasel). A weasel that stands upright (often using its tail).
オオタチ: 大 (*ō*, big) + (o) *tachi* from *Otachi* line; the grown, elongated weasel.
ホーホー: Onomatopoeia for an owl’s hoot in Japanese.
ヨルノズク: 夜 (*yoru*, night) + (木菟/梟) *nozuku* (horned owl). A nocturnal owl.
レディバ: From “ladybug” with emphasis on *redi* (“red”); a little ladybird beetle.
レディアン: Evolves *Ledyba*; often analyzed as “lady” + “guardian,” hinting at a starry protector motif.
イトマル: 糸 (*ito*, thread) + 丸 (*maru*, circle/ball). A small spider that spins thread.
アリアドス: Named after Ariadne, who gave Theseus thread to navigate the Labyrinth—appropriate for a web-spinning spider.
クロバット: Reads as “kuro” (black) + “bat,” and also evokes “acrobat,” capturing its swift, acrobatic flight.
ランターン: Katakana for “lantern,” reflecting its bioluminescent lure like a deep-sea anglerfish.
ピチュー: Diminutive of Pikachu; retains ピカ (pika, sparkle) + チュウ (chū, squeak), with a cuter baby-sounding form.
ピィ: Baby form of ピッピ (Pippi/Clefairy); clipped, high-pitched sound implying something tiny and cute.
ププリン: プチ (puchi, petite) + プリン (purin, pudding). Emphasizes a small, jiggly body.
トゲピー: 棘 (toge, spike) + ピヨ/ピー (piyo/pī, chick chirp). A spiky-shelled baby.
トゲチック: 棘 (toge, spike) + チック (chikku, from “chick” / チクチク prickly); angelic baby-bird vibes.
ネイティ: From “native”; references totemic/indigenous designs carried into its evolution.
ネイティオ: Evolves Natu’s theme; evokes “native” + “indio,” fitting its totem pole aesthetic and prophetic stance.
メリープ: From Merino (sheep breed) and めー (mē, baa). Also an anagram of “ampere,” hinting electricity.
モココ: もこもこ (moko-moko, fluffy). A very fluffy intermediate sheep.
デンリュウ: 電流 (denryū, electric current) + 竜 (ryū, dragon). A bright, lighthouse-like electric “dragon.”
キレイハナ: 綺麗 (kirei, beautiful) + 花 (hana, flower). A graceful blossom.
マリル: From “marine,” 丸い (marui, round), and 瑠璃 (ruri, lapis/azure). A round, blue river mouse.
マリルリ: Evolves Marill’s components with doubled “ruri,” emphasizing deeper blue and growth.
ウソッキー: 嘘つき (usotsuki, liar). A Rock-type that pretends to be a tree (fake wood).
ニョロトノ: ニョロニョロ (nyoro-nyoro, wriggle) + 殿 (tono, lord). The frog “lord” of the Poli line.
ハネッコ: 跳ねる (haneru, to hop) + 子 (ko, child). A light dandelion puff that hops on the wind.
ポポッコ: From たんぽぽ (tanpopo, dandelion); playful doubling indicates a puffball child.
ワタッコ: 綿 (wata, cotton) + 子 (ko, child). A cottony float-seed that drifts far.
エイパム: From “ape” + “palm,” referring to its hand-like tail.
ヒマナッツ: 向日葵 (himawari, sunflower) + ナッツ (nattsu, nuts). A sunflower seed.
キマワリ: From 向日葵 (himawari); voiced variation plays with “ki” to match naming patterns.
ヤンヤンマ: ヤンマ (yanma, large dragonfly) with reduplication for emphasis/speed.
ウパー: From “wooper looper,” a Japanese nickname for axolotl; cute aquatic salamander.
ヌオー: Languid interjection “nuō,” evoking a laid-back, dopey water fish/salamander.
エーフィ: From ESP (extrasensory perception) + フィ (fi, euphonic); a sun/psychic eeveelution.
ブラッキー: From English “black” with cute -y ending; a moon/dark eeveelution.
ヤミカラス: 闇 (yami, darkness) + 烏 (karasu, crow). A sinister night crow.
ヤドキング: 宿 (yado, lodging) + “king.” The royal apex of the Slowpoke line.
ムウマ: From 夢魔 (muma, nightmare/dream demon). A mischievous, wailing spirit.
アンノーン: From English “unknown”; glyph-like forms shaped as letters.
ソーナンス: From 相成す／そうなんす (*sō nansu*, slang “that’s how it is”); comedic catchphrase of a Japanese performer.
キリンリキ: キリン (*kirin*, giraffe) + 念力 (*nenriki*, psychokinesis). Palindrome theme matches the two-headed motif.
クヌギダマ: 櫟／クヌギ (*kunugi*, sawtooth oak) + 玉 (*tama*, ball), i.e., an oak gall/cone.
フォレトス: Blend of “forest/forêt” and “fortress”; an armored, shelled bug.
ノコッチ: From ノコギリ (nokogiri, saw) / 凹 (oko, notch) + diminutive; based on the mythical tsuchinoko.
ハガネール: 鋼 (*hagane*, steel) + elongated suffix; Onix’s steel evolution.
ブルー: From English “blue/bulldog”; grumpy pink bulldog fairy.
ハリーセン: 針 (*hari*, needle) + 千 (*sen*, thousand) — a very spiky puffer.
ハッサム: From “scissor(s)” in Japanese phonology; pincer-armed mantis.
ツボツボ: 壺 (*tsubo*, pot) doubled; a tiny creature living in a pot-like shell.
ヘラクロス: Named for the Hercules beetle; “hera” evokes “hera-/hero.”
ニューラ: Likely from “new”/“nyā” (meow) + “weasel”; a sharp-clawed weasel cat.
ヒメグマ: 姫 (*hime*, princess) + 熊 (*guma/kuma*, bear) — a cute little bear.
マグマッグ: マグマ (magma) with playful doubling; molten slug.
マグカルゴ: Portmanteau of magma and escargot/cargo; lava snail.
ウリムー: 瓜坊 (*uribō*, boar piglet) + ムー (mū); a piglet boar.
イノムー: 猪 (*ino*, boar) + ムー (mū); shaggy adult boar.
サニーゴ: “Sunny” + 珊瑚 (*sango*, coral); bright pink coral.
テッポウオ: 鉄砲魚 (*teppōuo*, archerfish) / 鉄砲 (teppō, gun); shoots water like a gun.
オクタン: From “octopus” with engine/“octane” pun; cannon-like siphon.
マンタイン: From manta ray; serene glider with Remoraid partner.
エアームド: 空気 (air) + 武土/armed (phonetic); steel bird armored like weapons.
キングドラ: Straight blend; Horsea line’s dragon monarch.
ゴマゾウ: 胡麻 (*goma*, sesame spots) + 象 (*zō*, elephant) with cute -ō; a speckled baby elephant.
ポリゴン２: Sequel/upgrade to Porygon; software versioning joke.
オドシシ: 驚かす／脅す (*odosu*, to scare) + 鹿 (*shika/shishi*, deer); antlers induce illusions.
ドーブル: From “doodle”/“daub”; painter beagle with a tail brush.
バルキー: From “bulky”; a young fighter before branching evolution.
カポエラー: From the Brazilian martial art *capoeira*; spins on its head.
ムチュール: 夢中 (*muchū*, in a trance/absorbed) + cute suffix; kissing motif.
ブビィ: Onomatopoeic *bubi/bubu* (bubbling) with baby vibe; magma infant.
ミルタンク: From “milk tank”; dairy cow that stores milk.
ライコウ: 雷 (*rai*, thunder) + 皇／吼 (*kō*, emperor/howl). Thunder beast.
エンテイ: 炎 (*en*, flame) + 帝 (*tei*, emperor). Volcanic beast.
スイクン: 水 (*sui*, water) + 君 (*kun*, lord/monarch). North wind/water beast.
ヨーギラス: Evokes “yō” (youth) + -giras line suffix; larval rock beast.
サナギラス: 蛹 (*sanagi*, chrysalis) + line suffix; pupa stage.
ルギア: Invented mythic name; guardian of the seas/storms.
ホウオウ: 鳳凰 (*hōō*), the East Asian auspicious phoenix.
キモリ: 木 (*ki*, tree/wood) + ヤモリ／守り (*yamori/mamori*, gecko/protect). A gecko that lives among trees and is swift and protective.
ジュカイン: Often parsed as “jungle” + evergreen tree nuance (カイン) or English “-tile/–ile”; a swift, bladed forest lizard.
アチャモ: 熱い (*atsui/acha*, hot) + 雛 (*hiyoko*, chick) with cute ending -mo. A fiery chick.
ワカシャモ: 若 (*waka*, young) + 軍鶏 (*shamo*, fighting cock). A young fighting chicken.
バシャーモ: ばしゃ (basha, whoosh/splash) + 軍鶏 (*shamo*). A blazing martial rooster.
ミズゴロウ: 水 (*mizu*, water) + ドジョウ (*dojo*, loach). References amphibious, mud-dwelling nature.
ヌマクロー: 沼 (*numa*, marsh) + クロウ (claw/craw). A marsh-stomping amphibian.
ラグラージ: Blend suggesting a very large swamp-dweller, powerful in wetlands.
ポチエナ: ポチ (*Pochi*, common dog name) + “hyena.” A small, scrappy hyena-like pup.
グラエナ: “Gura” evokes a deep growl + hyena; the imposing evolved hyena/wolf.
ジグザグマ: From “zigzag” + 熊 (*guma*, bear) or animal suffix -ma; its pathing and stripes are zigzagged.
マッスグマ: 真っ直ぐ (*massugu*, straight) + -ma. Runs straight in a line, unlike its pre-evo’s zigzags.
ケムッソ: 毛虫 (*kemushi*, caterpillar) with emphatic -sso; a spiny worm.
カラサリス: 殻 (*kara*, shell) + chrysalis; a white, silky cocoon form.
アゲハント: アゲハ (*ageha*, swallowtail butterfly) + “hunt”; a nectar-feeding but aggressive butterfly.
マユルド: 繭 (*mayu*, cocoon) + “hard” nuance; the darker, tougher cocoon.
ドクケイル: 毒 (*doku*, poison) + ケイル (from “scale”/“moth”); a toxic scale-shedding moth.
ハスボー: 蓮 (*hasu*, lotus) + 坊 (*bō*, boy/youngster). A little lotus-pad Pokémon.
ハスブレロ: 蓮 (*hasu*) + “sombrero”; a kappa-like dancer with a lily-pad hat.
タネボー: 種 (*tane*, seed) + 坊 (*bō*, boy). An acorn cap-sporting seed.
コノハナ: 木の花 (*konohana*, “tree’s flower”) / 木葉 (*konoha*, leaves); also hints at *Konoha* (leaf) folklore.
ダーテング: “Dirty/dark” + 天狗 (*tengu*, long-nosed yokai). A fan-wielding forest spirit.
スバメ: 燕 (*tsubame*, swallow). A small, speedy swallow.
オオスバメ: 大 (*ō*, great) + 燕 (*subame*, swallow). The larger, stronger swallow.
キャモメ: 鴎 (*kamome*, seagull) in katakana. A coastal gull.
ペリッパー: From “pelican,” emphasizing its huge bill and courier role.
ラルトス: Evokes “waltz”/“halts” with elegant, empathic vibe; starts the empath line leading to Gardevoir/Gallade.
キルリア: Evokes graceful, curving movements like ballet; a stylized coined name leading to Gardevoir.
サーナイト: Japanese reads like “sir + knight,” fitting its protective, knightly guardian motif.
アメタマ: 雨 (*ame*, rain) + 玉 (*tama*, drop/ball); a pond-skater that glides on rainy ponds.
アメモース: 雨 (*ame*, rain) + “moth”; eyespot “mask” wings after evolving from a rainy larva.
キノココ: キノコ (*kinoko*, mushroom) + 子 (*ko*, child); a small, grumpy mushroom.
キノガッサ: From キノコ (mushroom) + かさ/*gasa* (umbrella/cap); a fighting mushroom with a big cap.
ナマケロ: 怠ける (*namakeru*, to slack off). A very lazy sloth.
ヤルキモノ: やる気 (*yaruki*, motivation/drive) + 者 (*mono*, person). Hyperactive sloth stage.
ケッキング: Portmanteau of “slacking” + “king,” the indolent king of sloths.
ツチニン: 土 (*tsuchi*, earth) + 忍 (*nin*, ninja); a burrowing ninja cicada nymph.
テッカニン: Suggests 鉄 (*tetsu*, steel) or てっか (blazing fast) + 忍 (*nin*, ninja); a lightning-fast ninja cicada.
ヌケニン: 抜け忍 (*nukenin*, a defector ninja); a hollow shell left behind that gains eerie life.
ゴニョニョ: ごにょごにょ (*gonyo-gonyo*, to mutter). A timid whispering Pokémon.
ドゴーム: 轟音 (*gōon*, roaring sound); stomps and shouts loudly.
バクオング: 爆音 (*bakuon*, explosive/loud sound). A living subwoofer.
マクノシタ: 幕下 (*maku-no-shita*), a sumo rank below the main ring; a trainee sumo.
ハリテヤマ: 張り手 (*harite*, sumo open-hand strike) + 山 (*yama*, mountain); a powerful sumo.
ルリリ: 瑠璃 (*ruri*, lapis/azure) with a cutesy doubled ending; tiny blue mouse.
ノズパス: Huge nose + compass motif (always points north); rock guide.
エネコ: エネルギー (energy) + 猫 (*neko*, cat); a peppy kitten.
エネコロロ: From エネコ + ころころ (*korokoro*, rolling/purring); a carefree, pampered cat.
ヤミラミ: 闇 (*yami*, darkness) + wordplay suggesting 恨み (*urami*, grudge) / gems; a gem-eyed imp.
クチート: 口 (*kuchi*, mouth) + “cheat”; a deceiver with jaws on the back of its head.
ココドラ: 子 (*ko*, child) reduplicated + ドラ (as in ドラゴン/monster). A small iron armor beast.
コドラ: Evolves from Kokodora; name drops one “ko” to show growth.
ボスゴドラ: ボス (boss) + ゴドラ (evokes Godzilla-like kaiju). The armored boss.
チャーレム: Coined name evoking “charm/cha” + “-lem”; a yogi that fights while meditating.
ラクライ: 落雷 (*rakurai*, lightning strike). A hound charged with static.
プラスル: From “plus”; a cheerleader mouse that boosts allies.
マイナン: From “minus”; a partner to Plusle that specializes in support.
バルビート: Firefly whose tail glows to a beat; name evokes light + rhythm.
イルミーゼ: From “illuminate”; a firefly that leads Volbeat swarms with light.
ゴクリン: ごくり (*gokuri*, gulp) + -n; a stomach on legs.
マルノーム: 丸呑み (*marunomi*, to swallow whole). A big purple glutton.
キバニア: 牙 (*kiba*, fang) + “piranha”; a vicious river fish.
サメハダー: 鮫 (*same*, shark) + 鮫肌 (*samehada*, sharkskin/rough skin); a torpedo shark.
ホエルコ: “Whale” + 子 (*ko*, child). A playful baby whale.
ホエルオー: From “whale” and 大／王 (*ō*, great/king). The colossal whale Pokémon.
ドンメル: ドン (*don*, thudding/heavy) + “camel.” A dull, placid camel that stores magma.
コータス: From “coal” + tortoise; burns coal in its shell to emit smoke.
バネブー: バネ (*bane*, spring) + ブー (*bū*, pig oink). It bounces on its springy tail.
ブーピッグ: From *bū* (oink) + pig; a jujitsu-dancing pig that channels psychic power.
パッチール: パッチ (*patchi*, patch) + シール (*shīru*, sticker); spot patterns vary individually.
ナックラー: Evokes “knuckle” and biting power; an antlion that digs pitfall traps.
ビブラーバ: From “vibration” + larva; wings buzz with ultrasonic waves.
サボネア: サボテン (*saboten*, cactus) stylized; a spiny desert cactus.
ノクタス: From “noct-” (night) + cactus; a night-stalking scarecrow cactus.
チルット: Onomatopoeic chirp (*chiru/chiru*) with cute ending; cotton-winged bird.
チルタリス: Continues the *Chiru* line with a lofty aria/altus feel; a cloud-like songbird dragon.
ザングース: 斬 (*zan*, to slash) + “mongoose.” Traditional foe of snakes.
ハブネーク: ハブ (*habu*, pit viper) + “snake.” Long-standing rival to Zangoose.
ルナトーン: From Latin *luna* (moon) + stone; a crescent moon meteorite.
ソルロック: From Latin *sol* (sun) + rock; a sunlike meteorite.
ドジョッチ: ドジョウ (*dojo*, loach) + -ッチ (diminutive). A slippery mud fish.
ナマズン: 鯰 (*namazu*, catfish) + -n; quake-foretelling catfish of folklore.
ヘイガニ: 兵 (*hei*, soldier) + 蟹 (*kani*, crab) sound shift; a hardy invasive crayfish.
シザリガー: シザー (*shizā*, scissor) + ザリガニ (*zarigani*, crayfish). A violent rogue crayfish.
ヤジロン: 矢尻 (*yajiri*, arrowhead); top/figurine that spins.
ネンドール: 粘土 (*nendo*, clay) + doll; based on ancient haniwa figures.
リリーラ: From “lily” with soft ending; a fossil sea lily (crinoid).
ユレイドル: 揺れる (*yureru*, to sway) + “idol/doll”; a swaying sea-lily predator.
ヒンバス: 貧 (*hin*, poor/meager) + “bass.” An unattractive but hardy fish.
ミロカロス: Evokes “melodic” and Greek *kalos* (beautiful); the elegant serpent.
ポワルン: From ふわふわ/*ぽわぽわ* (fluffy/floaty) + ルン (*run*, cheerful tone); a weather-formed body.
カクレオン: 隠れる (*kakureru*, to hide) + “chameleon.” A color-shifting lizard.
カゲボウズ: 影 (*kage*, shadow) + 坊主 (*bōzu*, monk/doll); a vengeful little puppet.
ジュペッタ: From “puppet”; a discarded doll animated by grudges.
ヨマワル: 夜回り (*yomawari*, night patrol); a skulking reaper.
サマヨール: 彷徨う (*samayō*, to wander). A one-eyed wandering specter.
トロピウス: From “tropic”; a banana-bearing dinosaur of the tropics.
チリーン: Onomatopoeia for a wind chime’s ring; a healing chime spirit.
アブソル: From “absolute/absolution”; a disaster-foretelling beast misunderstood as ominous.
ソーナノ: From そうなの (*sō na no*, “is that so?”), matching Wobbuffet’s ソーナンス (“that’s how it is”).
ユキワラシ: 雪 (*yuki*, snow) + 童子 (*warashi*, child spirit). Based on yuki-warashi, a snow spirit.
オニゴーリ: 鬼 (*oni*, demon) + 氷 (*kōri*, ice). A demonic ice-face.
タマザラシ: 玉 (*tama*, ball) + 胡麻斑海豹 (*azarashi*, spotted seal). A round, rolling seal.
トドグラー: トド (*todo*, sea lion) + グラー (growl); a playful but strong pinniped.
トドゼルガ: トド (todo, sea lion) + 善牙 (zeruga, fierce tusks). A walrus-like beast.
パールル: From “pearl” with doubled ending for cuteness. A clam with a pearl.
ハンテール: Direct from English; a predatory deep-sea eel.
サクラビス: 桜 (*sakura*, cherry blossom) + abyss; a pink, graceful deep-sea eel.
タツベイ: 竜 (*tatsu*, dragon) + small-name suffix; a dragon aspirant.
コモルー: 籠る (*komoru*, to seclude/encase); a cocoon dragon.
ダンバル: From “dumbbell” with Japanese phonology; metallic weight shape.
メタグロス: From “metal” + gross (large); a huge, four-brained machine.
カイオーガ: 海 (*kai*, sea) + ogre; a leviathan of the ocean.
グラードン: From “ground” + suffix -don (common in dinosaur names). A continent-raising titan.
レックウザ: 烈空 (*rekkū*, violent sky) + -za; a sky serpent.
ジラーチ: From 幸 (*shiawase*, happiness) and borrowing “wish” from other languages. A wish-granting star.
ナエトル: 苗 (*nae*, sprout/seedling) + 亀 (*toru/toru*, turtle—phonetic). A seedling-backed turtle.
ハヤシガメ: 林 (*hayashi*, forest) + 亀 (*kame/game*, turtle). Bushes grow on its shell.
ドダイトス: 土台 (*dodai*, foundation/earth) + トータス (tortoise); a continent-like tortoise.
ヒコザル: 火 (*hi*, fire) + 子 (*ko*, child) + 猿 (*zaru*, monkey). A fiery little monkey.
モウカザル: 猛火 (*mōka*, fierce flames) + 猿 (*zaru*, monkey). Mid-stage fighter.
ゴウカザル: 豪火／劫火 (*gōka*, great blaze) + 猿 (*zaru*, monkey). A blazing martial sage.
ポッチャマ: ぽっちゃり (*pochari*, plump) + ちゃま/*sama* (child/master). A proud, plump penguin chick.
ポッタイシ: Coined from *potta* sound + 意志 (*ishi*, will) / 石 (*ishi*, stone). A princely penguin.
エンペルト: “Emperor” + ペンギン (penguin) nuance; trident-like beak evokes rulership.
ムックル: Onomatopoeic bird name; a small starling.
ムクバード: ムク (muku, from the line) + バード (bird). The adolescent starling.
ムクホーク: ムク + ホーク (hawk); a fierce raptor.
ビッパ: Coined beaver-like name with cute doubling; a simple-minded beaver.
コロボーシ: 転ぶ (*korobu*, roll) + beetle. A dung-rolling scarab.
コロトック: Onomatopoeia blending cricket chirps and ticking; a violinist cricket.
コリンク: Often read as 子 (*ko*, child) + “link”/“ring” sound; an electric lion cub.
レントラー: レントゲン (*rentogen*, X‑ray) shortened; can “see through” with x‑ray vision.
スボミー: 蕾 (*tsubomi*, bud) with sound shift; a tiny rosebud.
ズガイドス: 頭蓋 (*zuga i*, skull) + -ドス; a headbutting fossil.
ミノムッチ: 蓑虫 (*minomushi*, bagworm) + -っち (cute). A cloak-wearing larva.
ミノマダム: 蓑 (*mino*, straw raincoat) + “madam”; female evolution with different cloaks.
ミツハニー: 蜜 (*mitsu*, honey) + English “honey”; a honeycomb of three.
パチリス: パチパチ (*pachi‑pachi*, crackle/spark) + リス (*risu*, squirrel). An electric squirrel.
チェリンボ: From “cherry” + 坊 (*bō*, boy/child); a twin‑fruit cherry.
チェリム: From “cherry” + “bloom”; a cherry blossom that changes with sunlight.
カラナクシ: 殻 (*kara*, shell) + ナメクジ (*namekuji*, slug); a coastal sea slug.
トリトドン: From “triton” (sea god) + -don; a larger sea slug.
エテボース: 猿 (*ete*, monkey) + “boss”; a two-tailed master monkey.
フワンテ: ふわふわ (*fuwa*, light/fluffy) + balloon (*ente*). A soul-carrying balloon.
ミミロル: 耳 (*mimi*, ear) + ロール (roll); a bunny with rolled ears.
ムウマージ: From ムウマ (Misdreavus’ JP name) + mage; a sorceress ghost.
ドンカラス: ドン (mafia boss) + 烏 (*karasu*, crow). A crime-boss crow.
ニャルマー: ニャー (meow) + “allure”; a sly, charming cat.
ブニャット: ブタ (pig/fat) + ニャー (meow) + -ット; a hefty, mean cat.
リーシャン: 鈴 (*rin/rii*, bell) + 響 (*shan*, ring). A tiny bell spirit.
スカンプー: From “skunk” + プー (onomatopoeia for stink/fart). A stinky skunk.
ドーミラー: 銅 (*dō*, bronze) + 鏡 (*mirā*, mirror). Based on ancient mirrors.
ドータクン: 銅鐸 (*dōtaku*, ritual bronze bell). A bell spirit.
ウソハチ: 嘘 (*uso*, lie/false) + ハチ (*hachi*, eight/child); a fake bonsai.
マネネ: 真似 (*mane*, mimic) + -ne (childlike). A baby mime.
ピンプク: From “pin” (tiny) + ぷくぷく (*puku puku*, chubby). A round baby Chansey.
ペラップ: ペラペラ (*pera pera*, chatter) + parrot.
ミカルゲ: 三百六十 (*sanbyakurokuju*) → 108; a cursed spirit bound in stone.
フカマル: 咬む (*fukamu*, to bite) + 丸 (*maru*, round). A small land shark.
ガバイト: ガブガブ (*gabu gabu*, gnash/chomp) + bite. Mid dragon form.
ガブリアス: From ガブ (chomp) + “arch”/“gorge”/“landmass.” A supersonic land shark.
ゴンベ: ゴン (onomatopoeia for gulp) + べ (from 食べる, eat). A gluttonous baby.
ルカリオ: Inspired by “oracle”/“aura”/“Luca.” A jackal aura fighter.
カバルドン: From hippo + -don (tooth/large creature). A sand hippo.
マスキッパ: 方言 for Venus flytrap; a snapping plant.
ケイコウオ: 蛍光 (*keikō*, fluorescence) + 魚 (*uo*, fish). A glowing fish.
タマンタ: 玉 (*tama*, sphere) + manta (ray). A baby manta ray.
ユキカブリ: 雪 (*yuki*, snow) + 被り (*kaburi*, covering). A snow-covered tree.
ユキノオー: 雪 (*yuki*, snow) + 王 (*ō*, king). A yeti snow king.
マニューラ: 魔 (*ma*, demon) + ニューラ (Sneasel’s JP name). A vicious clawed weasel.
ジバコイル: 磁場 (*jiba*, magnetic field) + coil; UFO-like magnet.
ベロベルト: ベロ (bero, tongue) + ベルト (beruto, belt). A tongue-belt Pokémon.
ドサイドン: ドサイ (dosai, massive) + -don (dinosaur suffix). A bulky armored rhino.
モジャンボ: もじゃもじゃ (*moja moja*, bushy) + jumbo. A tangle of vines.
エレキブル: エレキ (ereki, electric) + ブル (buru, bull/ogre). A power-wired beast.
ブーバーン: From Magmar’s JP name (ブーバー) + burn; a cannon-armed burner.
トゲキッス: From “toge” (spike, Togepi line) + kiss; a blessed jubilee bird.
メガヤンマ: From “mega” + ヤンマ (*yanma*, dragonfly). A giant dragonfly predator.
ポリゴンＺ: From Porygon + letter Z; corrupted upgrade.
エルレイド: From エル (elegant/knightly) + blade. Male Ralts evolution.
ダイノーズ: 大 (*dai*, great) + nose. A magnetic guardian with nose motif.
ヨノワール: 夜 (*yo*, night) + noir; grim reaper spirit.
ユキメノコ: 雪女 (*yuki-onna*, snow woman ghost) + 子 (*ko*, girl). A frosty yokai.
ロトム: An anagram of “motor.” A ghost inhabiting appliances.
ユクシー: From “you” + “knowledge” roots; one of the lake trio.
レジギガス: Regi prefix + giga (huge). Master of the Regis.
ギラティナ: From “girasole” (sunflower, turning) or “girati” (Italian: turn) + -tina. Renegade deity.
マナフィ: From “mana” (life energy) + sea feel. Guardian of the sea.
ダークライ: From “dark” + 来 (*rai*, coming) or cry. Bringer of nightmares.
アルセウス: From “arch” (origin) + deus (god). The creator deity of Pokémon.
ビクティニ: From “victory” + diminutive; a small victory Pokémon.
ツタージャ: 蔦 (*tsuta*, vine) + 蛇 (*ja*, snake). A smug grass snake.
ジャノビー: 蛇 (*ja*, snake) + noble. A refined serpent.
ジャローダ: 蛇 (*ja*, snake) + ロード (lord). Regal serpent.
ポカブ: ぽかぽか (*poka*, warm) + 豚 (*buta/bu*). A fire piglet.
チャオブー: チャオ (Chinese: “to fry” / roar) + ブー (oink). Fiery fighting pig.
エンブオー: 炎 (*en*, flame) + boar. A fire boar warrior.
ミジュマル: 水 (*mizu*, water) + 丸 (*maru*, child suffix). A playful otter.
フタチマル: 二 (*futa*, two) + 丸 (*maru*). Twin-sword otter.
ダイケンキ: 大 (*dai*, great) + 剣 (*ken*, sword) + 騎 (*ki*, knight). A samurai otter.
ミネズミ: 見 (*mi*, watch) + 鼠 (*nezumi*, mouse). A vigilant sentry.
ミルホッグ: 見る (*miru*, see) + hog. A watchful meerkat.
ハーデリア: From “hardy” + terrier; a faithful guard dog.
ムーランド: From “muzzle/mutt” + land. A noble mustached hound.
チョロネコ: ちょろい (*choroi*, sly/easy trickster) + 猫 (*neko*, cat). A mischievous cat.
ヤナッキー: Same as above with -キー for emphasis; fierce grass monkey.
バオッキー: Same as Pansear; fiery hot monkey.
ヒヤップ: 冷やす (*hiyasu*, to cool) + monkey. Water monkey.
ヒヤッキー: Same as above, with -キー emphasis. Water monkey.
ムンナ: From “moon” + 子 (*na*, diminutive). Dream eater piglet.
マメパト: 豆 (*mame*, bean/small) + 鳩 (*hato*, pigeon). Tiny pigeon.
ハトーボー: 鳩 (*hato*, pigeon) + 坊 (*bō*, boy). A calm dove.
ケンホロウ: 拳 (*ken*, fist) + 雉 (*horō*, pheasant). A martial pheasant.
シママ: 縞 (*shima*, stripe) + 馬 (*uma*, horse). A striped foal.
ゼブライカ: From “zebra” + 雷 (*raika*, thunder). A thunder zebra.
ダンゴロ: 団子 (*dango*, lump) + 石 (*ishi*, rock). A round rock.
コロモリ: 衣 (*koromo*, cloth) + 蝙蝠 (*komori*, bat). A fuzzy bat.
ココロモリ: 心 (*kokoro*, heart) + bat. A heart-nosed bat.
モグリュー: 土竜 (*mogura*, mole) + dragon/claw (*ryū*). A digging mole.
ドリュウズ: ドリル (drill) + 土竜 (*mogura*, mole). A steel mole with drills.
タブンネ: 多分ね (*tabun ne*, “maybe”). A kindly, hearing healer.
ドッコラー: 独鈷 (*dokko*, Buddhist tool) / ドッコイ (heave-ho) + timber. A worker Pokémon.
ドテッコツ: 鉄骨 (*tekkotsu*, iron beam) with prefix. A construction Pokémon.
ローブシン: 老 (*rō*, old) + 武神 (*bushin*, war god). A muscular elder.
オタマロ: おたまじゃくし (*otamajakushi*, tadpole). A singing tadpole.
ガマガル: 蝦蟇 (*gama*, toad) + がる (croak). A warty toad.
ガマゲロゲ: がま (toad) + ゲロゲロ (ribbit croak). A vibrating toad.
ナゲキ: 投げ (*nage*, throw). A red judo thrower.
ダゲキ: 打撃 (*dageki*, strike). A blue karate striker.
クルミル: 包む (*kurumu*, wrap) + 虫 (*mushi*, bug). A leaf-wrapped larva.
クルマユ: 包む (*kurumu*, wrap) + 繭 (*mayu*, cocoon). A cloaked cocoon bug.
ハハコモリ: 母 (*haha*, mother) + 蟷螂 (*kamakiri*). A nurturing mantis.
フシデ: 節 (*fushi*, segment/joint) + millepede. A small centipede.
ホイーガ: From “wheel” + bug. A rolling cocoon bug.
モンメン: 綿 (*men*, cotton) + 蒙綿 (monmen, cotton). A cotton fluff.
エルフーン: From “elf” + ふんわり (*funwari*, fluffy). A mischievous fluff.
チュリネ: From “tulip” + 根 (*ne*, root). A tulip bulb.
ドレディア: From “dress” + lady. A dancing noble flower.
バスラオ: From “bass” + 荒い (*arai*, rough/violent). An aggressive fish.
メグロコ: 目黒 (*meguro*, black eyes) + crocodile. A desert croc.
ワルビル: 悪 (*warui*, bad) + crocodile. A bandit croc.
ワルビアル: 悪 (*warui*, bad) + crocodile. A gangster croc.
ダルマッカ: 達磨 (*daruma*, traditional doll) + -ッカ (cute diminutive). A fiery daruma doll.
ヒヒダルマ: ヒヒ (hihi, baboon) + 達磨 (*daruma*, doll). A fiery daruma baboon.
イシズマイ: 石住まい (*ishi-zumai*, rock dweller). A hermit crab with a rock shell.
イワパレス: 岩 (*iwa*, rock) + “palace.” A giant rock-carrying crab.
ズルッグ: ずるい (*zurui*, sly/slouchy) + gurgle. A pants-drooping lizard.
ズルズキン: From ずる (*zuru*, sly) + 頭巾 (*zukin*, hood). A gangster lizard.
デスマス: From “death” + mask. A spirit with its mask.
アバゴーラ: Possibly from アバ (aba, archaic) + tortoise. A fossil turtle.
ヤブクロン: 袋 (*fukuro*, bag) + trash. A garbage bag Pokémon.
ダストダス: From “dust” + 出す (*dasu*, to emit). A trash heap.
ゾロア: From “zorro” (fox in Spanish). A trickster fox.
チラーミィ: ちらちら (*chira*, flicker) + ミィ (cute squeak). A tidy chinchilla.
ゴチム: From “gothic” + child suffix. A gothic doll.
ゴチミル: From “gothic” + ミル (mil, middle). A gothic teen.
コアルヒー: 子 (*ko*, child) + アヒル (*ahiru*, duck). A duckling.
バニプッチ: From “vanilla” + small suffix. An ice cream cone.
バニリッチ: From “vanilla” + rich. A bigger ice cream cone.
バイバニラ: From “bye-bye vanilla.” A twin ice cream cone.
シキジカ: 鹿 (*shika*, deer) + 子 (*jika/ko*, child). A seasonal deer.
メブキジカ: 芽吹き (*mebuki*, budding) + 鹿 (*shika*, deer). A seasonal stag.
エモンガ: From “electric” + モモンガ (*momonga*, flying squirrel).
カブルモ: 頭突き (*kaburi*, headbutt) + 虫 (*mushi*, bug). A charging bug.
タマゲタケ: 驚く (*tamage*, to be surprised) +茸 (*take*, mushroom). A mushroom mimic.
モロバレル: ばれる (*bareru*, exposed) + mushroom. A mushroom with Pokéball caps.
ママンボウ: ママ (mama) + 翻車魚 (*manbō*, ocean sunfish). A motherly healer.
バチュル: バチバチ (*bachibachi*, crackle) + bug. A tiny electric spider.
デンチュラ: 電 (*den*, electric) + tarantula. A large spider.
テッシード: 鉄 (*tetsu*, iron) + seed. A spiky seed.
ナットレイ: From “nut” + thorn. A spiky vine ball.
ギギアル: Reduplication of gear. A pair of gears.
ギギギアル: From “gear” repeated thrice. A full gear system.
シビシラス: 痺れ (*shibire*, numb) + シラス (*shirasu*, whitebait fish). A tiny electric eel.
シビビール: 痺れ (*shibire*, numb) + “eel.” A mid-stage eel.
シビルドン: 痺れ (*shibire*) + “don” (large/dragon suffix). A final eel predator.
リグレー: From “little grey,” a common alien depiction.
オーベム: From “OBE” (close encounter code) or UFO slang. A classic alien.
ヒトモシ: 火 (*hi*, fire) + 灯 (*tomoshi*, lamp). A candle with a spirit flame.
キバゴ: 牙 (*kiba*, fang) + 子 (*ko/go*, child). A tusked child dragon.
オノンド: 斧 (*ono*, axe) + sound suffix. A tusked axe dragon.
オノノクス: 斧 (*ono*, axe) + “noxious/ferocious.” A powerful axe dragon.
クマシュン: 熊 (*kuma*, bear) + “achoo” sneeze. A sniffly bear cub.
ツンベアー: From “tsun” (cold) + bear. A fierce polar bear.
チョボマキ: ちょぼ (*chobo*, small) + 巻き (*maki*, roll/wrap). A wrapped clam bug.
マッギョ: 真っ平 (*mappira*, flat) + 魚 (*gyo*, fish). A flat fish.
コジョフー: 小 (*ko*, small) + 拳法 (*kenpō*). A martial arts weasel.
コジョンド: 小 (*ko*) + 拳道 (*kendō*) + “don.” A martial master weasel.
クリムガン: Crimson-colored dragon with a rocky face.
コマタナ: 小 (*ko*, small) + 刀 (*katana*, sword). A small bladed pawn.
キリキザン: 切り刻む (*kirikizamu*, to slash up). A bladed bishop warrior.
ワシボン: 鷲 (*washi*, eagle) + 坊 (*bon*, boy). A young eagle.
バルジーナ: From “vulture” + feminine suffix. A matriarchal vulture.
クイタラン: 食う (*kuu*, eat) + anteater. A fire anteater.
ジヘッド: “Zwei” (two in German) + head. A two-headed dragon.
サザンドラ: Drei (three in German) + dragon. A three-headed hydra dragon.
ウルガモス: From “Uru” (to burn) + moth. A sun moth.
コバルオン: From “cobalt” + lion. One of the Musketeer trio.
レシラム: From 白 (*shiro*, white) rearranged. A yin-yang dragon.
ゼクロム: From 黒 (*kuro*, black) rearranged. A yin-yang dragon.
キュレム: From 凍る (*kyūru/kyōre*, to freeze). An icy dragon.
ケルディオ: From “colt” + Latin deo (god). A young musketeer horse.
ゲノセクト: From “gene” + insect. A cybernetic bug revived by Team Plasma.
ハリマロン: 針 (*hari*, needle) + マロン (*maron*, chestnut). A spiny chestnut Pokémon.
ハリボーグ: 針 (*hari*, needle) + 防具 (*bōgu*, armor). A bulky armored chestnut.
ブリガロン: From “brigand/bulwark” + marron. A knightly chestnut warrior.
フォッコ: From “fox” + 火 (*hi*, fire). A fennec fox with fire powers.
テールナー: “Tail” + 火 (*nā*, from burner). A fox magician with wand-like tail.
マフォクシー: 魔法 (*mahō*, magic) + “fox.” A mystical mage fox.
ケロマツ: ケロケロ (*kero*, frog croak) + 沫 (*matsu*, bubbles/foam). A froggy ninja.
ゲコガシラ: ゲコゲコ (*geko*, croak) + 頭 (*gashira*, head). A nimble frog.
ゲッコウガ: 月光 (*gekkō*, moonlight) + 忍者 (*ninja*). A stealthy ninja frog.
ホルビー: 掘る (*horu*, to dig) + “bunny.” A digging rabbit.
ホルード: 掘る (*horu*, dig) + “lord.” A burly rabbit with shovel ears.
ヤヤコマ: Small bird motif; “koma” often used for sparrows. A tiny robin.
ヒノヤコマ: 火の (*hi no*, fire) + “yakoma.” A fiery mid-stage robin.
コフキムシ: 粉吹き (*kofuki*, powder-sprinkling) + 虫 (*mushi*, bug). A powder bug.
コフーライ: 粉 (*ko*) + 風来 (*fūrai*, wanderer). A wandering cocoon bug.
ビビヨン: From “vivid” + “papillon” (French for butterfly). A patterned butterfly.
シシコ: 獅子 (*shishi*, lion) + 子 (*ko*, child). A little lion cub.
カエンジシ: 火炎 (*kaen*, flame) + 獅子 (*jishi*, lion). A fiery lion.
フラベベ: From “flower” + “bébé” (French for baby). A fairy flower child.
フラエッテ: From “flower” + French “été.” A dancing fairy with a flower.
メェークル: めぇ (*mee*, goat bleat) + 来る (*kuru*, to come). A rideable goat kid.
ヤンチャム: やんちゃ (*yancha*, mischievous) + panda. A playful panda cub.
ゴロンダ: ゴロ (goro, roar) + panda. A fighting panda boss.
トリミアン: From “trim” + dog. A poodle with customizable coats.
ニャスパー: ニャー (*nya*, meow) + “esper.” A psychic kitten.
ニャオニクス: ニャー (*nya*, meow) + onyx/psychic suffix. A mystical feline.
ヒトツキ: 一突き (*hitotsuki*, one thrust). A haunted sword.
ニダンギル: 二段斬る (*nidangiru*, two-stage slash). Twin haunted swords.
ギルガルド: From “guard” + “gild.” A royal sword and shield ghost.
シュシュプ: From シュシュ (chouchou, perfume) + puff. A perfume bird.
フレフワン: From “fragrance” + fluffy. A perfumed bird dancer.
ペロッパフ: ペロペロ (*pero*, lick) + puff. A cotton candy fairy.
ペロリーム: ペロペロ (*pero*, lick) + cream. A whipped cream fairy.
マーイーカ: いか (*ika*, squid) with phrase まあいいか (“oh well”). A tricky squid.
カラマネロ: 烏賊 (*ika*, squid) + 狡い (*karai*, tricky). A hypnotic squid.
カメテテ: 亀 (*kame*, turtle) + 手 (*te*, hand). A barnacle Pokémon.
ガメノデス: 亀 (*kame*, turtle) + death. A multi-limbed barnacle beast.
クズモー: 海藻くず (*kuzu*, scrap seaweed) + child. A camouflaged kelp seahorse.
ドラミドロ: From “dragon” + 海藻 (*midoro*, seaweed). A dragon kelp.
ウデッポウ: 腕 (*ude*, arm) + 鉄砲 (*teppō*, gun). A pistol shrimp.
ブロスター: From “blaster” + lobster. A shrimp with a giant cannon claw.
チゴラス: 小 (*chi*, small/child) + dragon. A baby tyrant dinosaur.
ガチゴラス: From “gachi” (serious/strong) + dragon. A fierce T. rex.
デデンネ: デン (den, electricity) + ネズミ (*nezumi*, mouse). An electric fairy rodent.
メレシー: From “mercy” + jewel imagery. A diamond-like fairy.
ヌメラ: From ぬめぬめ (*numenume*, slimy). A gooey dragon larva.
ヌメイル: From ぬめぬめ (*numenume*) + snail. A slimy dragon.
ヌメルゴン: From ぬめぬめ (*numenume*) + dragon. A gentle slime dragon.
クレッフィ: From “clé” (French for key) + key. A fairy keyring.
ボクレー: 木の株 (*kikabu*, stump) + 幽霊 (*yūrei*, ghost). A stump ghost.
オーロット: 大樹 (*ōki na ki*, large tree) + spirit. A haunted elder tree.
バケッチャ: 化け (*bake*, ghost/monster) + 南瓜 (*kabocha*, pumpkin). A pumpkin ghost.
パンプジン: From “pumpkin” + 人 (*jin*, person/genie). A spooky pumpkin spirit.
カチコール: カチコチ (*kachikochi*, frozen solid) + core. An iceberg Pokémon.
オンバット: 音 (*on*, sound) + bat. A bat that emits ultrasonic cries.
オンバーン: 音 (*on*, sound) + wyvern. A draconic bat.
ゼルネアス: From “Cernunnos,” a Celtic deity associated with stags.
イベルタル: From “Y” shape + death imagery. A destructive dark bird.
ディアンシー: From “diamond” + fancy. A jewel princess Pokémon.
フーパ: From “hoop” + playful suffix. A mischievous genie.
ボルケニオン: From “volcano” + ion. A steam-powered fire/water beast.
モクロー: 木 (*moku*, wood) + フクロウ (*fukurō*, owl). A grass-type owl.
フクスロー: フクロウ (*fukurō*, owl) + throw/slash. A stylish owl.
ニャビー: ニャー (*nya*, meow) + 火 (*hi*, fire). A fiery kitten.
ニャヒート: ニャー (*nya*, meow) + heat. A hot-blooded cat.
ガオガエン: ガオ (gao, roar) + 火炎 (*kaen*, flame). A fiery wrestling cat.
アシマリ: 足 (*ashi*, foot) + 鞠 (*mari*, ball). A playful sea lion.
オシャマリ: おしゃま (*oshama*, stylish/precocious) + 鞠 (*mari*, ball). A dancing seal.
アシレーヌ: 足 (*ashi*, foot/sea lion) + siren. A singing mermaid seal.
ツツケラ: 突く (*tsutsuku*, to peck) + 啄木鳥 (*kera*, woodpecker). A tiny pecker bird.
ケララッパ: From “kera” (woodpecker) + ラッパ (*rappa*, trumpet). A beak instrument bird.
